body_html:
The issue was because for Resnet and VGG models the classes are shifted by 1.
So, inception has 1000 classes and one more for background while Resnet and VGG don't,
so the shift is needed.

More information can be found here: https://github.com/tensorflow/models/tree/master/slim#pre-trained-models

I think it makes sense to update the ipython notebook with a specific example for Resnet or VGG.

body:
The issue was because for Resnet and VGG models the classes are shifted by 1.
So, inception has 1000 classes and one more for background while Resnet and VGG don't,
so the shift is needed.

More information can be found here: https://github.com/tensorflow/models/tree/master/slim#pre-trained-models

I think it makes sense to update the ipython notebook with a specific example for Resnet or VGG.
